item.title: Notification of Your Eldercare Rights Act

summary.summary-text:
Notification of Your Eldercare Rights

This bill directs the Department of Labor to:

  • draft disclosures which describe the rights and liabilities of customers and providers of domestic care services,
  • require that any provider of domestic care services give such disclosures to each customer before entering into a contract with the customer, and
  • disclose to the customer whether the individual or individuals who will provide such services are employees of the provider of domestic care services or independent contractors.

It shall be unlawful, and subject to certain civil penalties, for any provider of domestic care services to contract with a customer without first providing the disclosure document required by this Act.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
